skill.name: mermaid-diagramming
skill.description: Create Mermaid diagrams in Obsidian including flowcharts, sequence diagrams, class diagrams, and more. Use when visualizing processes, system architectures, workflows, or any structured relationships in Obsidian notes.
skill.summary: Create Mermaid diagrams in Obsidian including flowcharts, sequence diagrams, class diagrams, and mor...
skill.author: BitYoungjae

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing markdown files with Mermaid syntax examples. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or environment variable reads. All content is static educational reference material about diagram creation.

content.value_statement: Add visual diagrams to your Obsidian notes without external tools. This skill provides complete syntax reference for 17 diagram types including flowcharts, sequence diagrams, class diagrams, Gantt charts, and more.
actual_capabilities: Create 17 diagram types: flowcharts, sequence, class, state, Gantt, gitgraph, mindmap, pie, ER, journey, timeline, quadrant, sankey, xychart, block, and architecture
Apply node shapes, styling, colors, and custom classes to diagrams
Define diagram direction, relationships, and complex layouts
Add accessibility titles and descriptions to diagrams
Configure themes and custom styling with CSS-like syntax
limitations: Requires Obsidian's built-in Mermaid support (some cutting-edge features may not render)
JavaScript callbacks and click events are disabled for security
PDF export converts diagrams to raster images
Very large diagrams with 50+ nodes may slow rendering

use_cases.title: Document System Architecture
use_cases.description: Create sequence diagrams, class diagrams, and architecture layouts to document code systems.

use_cases.title: Visualize Project Timelines
use_cases.description: Build Gantt charts, timelines, and journey diagrams to track progress and workflows.

use_cases.title: Add Visual Documentation
use_cases.description: Embed flowcharts and ER diagrams directly in documentation notes without external tools.

prompt_templates.title: Simple Flowchart
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a mermaid flowchart showing a simple decision process where [input] leads to [action] or [alternative].

prompt_templates.title: API Sequence
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a mermaid sequence diagram showing [service] calling [endpoint] and receiving response from [database].

prompt_templates.title: Database Schema
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a mermaid ER diagram for [entity] with relationships to [related entities] including primary keys and foreign keys.

prompt_templates.title: Project Timeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a mermaid Gantt chart for [project] with phases [phase names] and dependencies between tasks.

output_examples.input: Create a flowchart for user login process

best_practices: Use explicit hex colors in style commands for consistent appearance across Obsidian themes
Split large diagrams (50+ nodes) into multiple smaller diagrams for better performance
Add accessibility titles with accTitle and accDescr for screen reader support
Use classDef for reusable styles instead of individual inline styles
anti_patterns: Using click events or JavaScript callbacks (disabled in Obsidian)
Skipping accessibility titles for complex diagrams
Mixing tabs and spaces for indentation in mindmaps
Creating single-point charts that require Mermaid 10.3+ features

faq.question: What Mermaid versions does Obsidian support?
faq.answer: Obsidian includes a recent Mermaid version. Some beta features like architecture-beta may not be available in older versions.

faq.question: Can I export diagrams from Obsidian?
faq.answer: PDF export converts diagrams to images. For external sharing, capture diagrams as PNG or SVG using your device's screenshot tools.

faq.question: Why do colors look different between themes?
faq.answer: Obsidian themes affect diagram colors. Use explicit hex color values in style commands for consistent appearance.

faq.question: Is this skill safe to use?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill contains only documentation with Mermaid syntax examples. No code execution, network access, or file system changes occur.

faq.question: How many diagram types are supported?
faq.answer: The skill documents 17 diagram types: flowchart, sequence, class, state, Gantt, gitgraph, mindmap, pie, ER, journey, timeline, quadrant, sankey, xychart, block, and architecture.

faq.question: Can I use Mermaid outside of Obsidian?
faq.answer: Yes. Mermaid syntax is standard across many tools. Diagrams created here work in GitHub, GitLab, Notion, and other Mermaid-supported platforms.
